node.title: Western Australia set to reveal border reopening date today, tourism industry hails 'light at the end of the tunnel'
node.description: As the WA government prepares to reveal the state's reopening date today, tourism operators urge Premier Mark McGowan to "stay the course" while ensuring the plan is in step with other states and territories.
node.content:
["Today Premier Mark McGowan\u00a0is expected to set the date when Western Australia's borders will finally reopen to the eastern states and the rest of the\u00a0world.\u00a0", "Mr McGowan vowed to set the date in stone once the state reached the 80 per cent vaccination milestone for people over 12, which is due\u00a0to happen today.", "Once the hard border comes down, international and interstate travel will resume, with testing and vaccination requirements.", "Under the government's transition plan released in November, interstate arrivals will be required to be double dose vaccinated, return a negative PCR test 72 hours prior to departure\u00a0and undertake a test on arrival in WA.", "International arrivals would be required to do all of the above, as well as complete 14 days quarantine if they were deemed high risk, for example, if they were unvaccinated.", "Some restrictions would be introduced to help manage the spread of COVID-19 in WA, including face masks for some high-risk indoor settings and proof of vaccination for large events, nightclubs and the casino.", "Last week the Premier announced a plan to 'reconnect' WA with the world, by spending $185 million in measures to boost businesses and attract tourists, international students and workers to Western Australia when the state's borders reopen.", "The date was likely to be set for late January or early February, the Premier said, with an aim of reaching 90 per cent full vaccination across the over-12 cohort.", "It will be welcome news for families who have been separated since early last year, those who travel regularly for business, and even those just wanted to be able to holiday outside of WA.\u00a0", "Few have been looking forward to the reopening more than the tourism sector, which has been hit hard by the pandemic.\u00a0", "While some businesses have managed to stay afloat thanks to West Australians holidaying in their own backyards, others have folded, unable to hang on until the return of international and interstate travellers.\u00a0", "
'A light at the end of the tunnel'
", "One of the people who has been championing their cause over the course of the pandemic is Tourism Council WA chief executive\u00a0Evan Hall.\u00a0", "", "
Mr Hall says businesses have been pushed to the brink by almost two years of hard borders.(ABC News : Keane Bourke)
", "Mr Hall described the long-awaited plan to reopen\u00a0WA as \"a light at the end of the tunnel\".", "\"It's been a long time coming, particularly for those businesses here in Perth,\" he said.", "\"They've been shattered without international or interstate visitors,\" he said.\u00a0", "And while having a date set is an important step, it might be a while still until tourism businesses emerge from\u00a0the COVID-19 tunnel.", "
Travel agents prepare for two waves
", "Fiona Prosser's travel agency specialises in organising both personal and corporate travel and has managed to stay afloat during the pandemic.", "\"It's been incredibly challenging, however, we've been fortunate enough to have the cross-section of business, so we've had some essential corporate travel and we've had some resource travel that's kept us going.\"", "", "
Ms Prosser says it will take a few months for travellers to regain confidence about coming to WA for a holiday.\u00a0(ABC News: Keane Bourke)
", "She was hopeful about what the months ahead might hold.", "\"There's a lot of pent-up demand, we've seen a significant increase in inquiries, however, they haven't converted to bookings as yet,\" she said.", "Ms Prosser said travellers would likely return in two waves\u00a0once the border reopened.", "The first would be people desperate to reconnect with family\u00a0and business travellers who have been waiting to get back into WA.", "She said the second weave would be people\u00a0looking to holiday in the west, and would likely wait a little longer to see if WA re-imposes some restrictions.", "\"They require certainty, and we just don't have it.\u00a0So I think it will take a few months before people feel confident.\"", "", "
Going overseas? Here's what you need to know
", "
Mixed opinions on reopening plan
", "But West Australians remain divided over the looming opening\u00a0and the virus coming into the state.", "Hide Yabuuchi is desperate to return home to Japan as he has not been able to get back\u00a0there for three years.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"We are going to back to our country, so yeah, we can't wait for it,\" he said.", "", "
Hide Yabuuchi is eager to get home to Japan.\u00a0(ABC News: Keane Bourke)
", "And while some are apprehensive about the prospect of wearing masks again, Mr Yabuuchi doesn't mind.", "\"We have a mask culture back home anyway,\" he said.", "But others, like Elaine Faldi, are not\u00a0so keen on the reopening, having heard of the number of people dying with COVID in other states.", "", "
Elaine Faldi is more hesitant about the plan to drop WA's hard border.\u00a0(ABC News: Keane Bourke.)
", "\"I'm with Mr McGowan all the way. I think he's kept us safe really well,\" she said.", "But she admits the state will have to reopen at some point.", "\"We have to learn to live with it, it's just the way it is.\"", "
Tourism Council calls for consistent approach\u00a0
", "Mr Hall said one of the best things the government could do for the tourism sector was to not backtrack once it committed to an opening date.", "\"It is critical that once we open, we stay the course, that we are nationally consistent, that visitors to Australia know that it'll be no harder to get into WA than any other state,\" he said.", "\"That's what's going to be necessary to reconnect WA ... and we're confident [the government is] going to stay the course and bring that business back in.\"", "According to Mr Hall, another important aspect would be giving people a reason to come to WA and spend their money on tourism businesses.", "\"The real challenge is to make sure that we've got the business events, the major sporting events, all those locked in and that we don't lose them in the meantime,\" he said.", "\"That's what's going to drive business back to WA.\"", "The final piece of the puzzle, he said, would be convincing touring acts and sporting codes that they could plan to hold events in Perth.", "\"That means they need to be confident that the venue will be open and they will be able to go across the border and get out again.\"", "Perth lost the fifth and final men's Ashes Test after Cricket Australia\u00a0decided to move the match due to Western Australia's COVID-19 restrictions and was forced to swap the\u00a02022 Australian Surf Life Saving Championships with the Gold Coast,\u00a0which was due to host in 2023, to provide \"planning clarity\".", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
